info.title: ZEDEDA Job Service
info.description: The ZEDEDA Job Service is helper service to ZEDEDA Edge Application Service and ZEDEDA Edge Node Service. This service allows device administrators and operators to update Edge nodes and manage Edge Applications in bulk. Jobs execute edge node management and edge application management against a set of edge nodes or edge applications matching a selection criteria. For example, an operator would use a job to initiate and track installation of a lightning detection edge application on all edge nodes inistalled in all windmills in a particular Texas ZIP code (defined as a project).

get.description: Query the asynchronous job request records.

400.description: Bad Request. The API gateway did not process the request because of missing parameter or invalid value of parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

403.description: Forbidden. The API gateway did not process the request because the requestor does not have edge-app level access permission for the operation or does not have access scope to the project.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The API gateway did not receive a timely response from an upstream microservice it needed to communicate with in order to complete the request.

type.description: Scope of the action (e.g. project in case certificate expired at project level)

id.description: Unique id of the type (e.g. projectId in case of project type)
Id of the edge node cluster
System defined universally unique Id of the app instance

name.description: User defined name of the app instance, unique across the enterprise. Once app instance is created, name can’t be changed

title.description: User defined title of the app instance. Title can be changed at any time

description.description: Detailed description of the app instance

projectId.description: project name which the given app instance belong to

tags.description: Tags are name/value pairs that enable you to categorize resources. Tag names are case insensitive with max_length 512 and min_length 3. Tag values are case sensitive with max_length 256 and min_length 3.

clusterID.description: System defined universally unique clusterInstance ID, unique across the enterprise.

appId.description: User defined name of the edge app, unique across the enterprise. Once app name is created, name can’t be changed

deviceId.description: User defined name of the device name, unique across the enterprise. Once device name is defined, name can’t be changed

userData.description: Deprecated: Application initiazation script in cloud-config format to be used by cloud-init

customConfig.description: Application initialization script template in cloud-config format and user specified values

collectStatsIPAddr.description: holds the static Ip of the app instance

bundleversion.description: version of bundle app is referring to

cryptoKey.description: Crypto Key for decrypting user secret information

isSecretUpdated.description: This field tells whether user secrets has updated or not, especially the cusotom config

deploymentType.description: type of deployment for the app, eg: azure, k3s, standalone

userDefinedVersion.description: Instance version tells which edge app does this instance is running

startDelayInSeconds.description: start delay is the time in seconds EVE should wait after boot before starting the application instance

cloudInitVersion.description: Cloud-init version that indicates whether it necessary or not for cloud-init tool to restart in a guest

allowSnapshots.description: Flag to determine if a snapshot creation is allowed

maxSnapshots.description: Maximum number of snapshots allowed to be created

availableSnapshots.description: The list of available snapshots of the application instance

dockerComposeYamlText.description: Docker compose base64 encoded plain text
dockerComposeYamlText.title: internal field

datastoreIdList.description: List of datastore ids containing private registry credentials
datastoreIdList.title: internal field

instanceConfig.description:
XXX for now user will send only one common config. In future with complex
filtering and payload, user can send instance config per device.

access.description: Flags to enable / disable sending of logs generated by app instance to zedcloud

id.description: System defined universally unique Id of the app instance snapshot

name.description: Snapshot name. Unique across the application instance

config.description: The complete configuration of the application instance

activate.description: Indicates whether the snapshot should be activated

immediate.description: Indicates that the snapshot should be taken immediately

uuid.description: system generated unique id for an image

imvolId.description: immutable Volume for this base image

orderBy.description: OrderBy helps in sorting the list response

totalPages.description: Total number of pages to be fetched.

Cursor.description: Cursor helps in filtering the various list response like edge-app bundle list, model list, bundle list etc.
Cursor.title: Cursor is used as filter in list operation.

add.description: Add the Custom Config to App Instance (Optional. Default: False)

override.description: Override existing custom config from App Bundle Manifest (Optional. Default: False)

allowStorageResize.description: Allow Appinstance storage to be resized after app instance is created. (Optional. Default: False)

fieldDelimiter.description: Field delimiter used in specifying variables in template. (Required)

required.description: Indicates if the variable group is required to be specified for the App Instance. (Optional. Default:False)

condition.description: Condition to apply the variable group. (Optional. Default: None)

deploymentTag.description: deployment tag to be updated on the device

DeploymentTagUpdate.description: deployment tag will be required to target deployment version on the device
DeploymentTagUpdate.title: deployment tag required for the devices

tags.description: tag to be updated on the device

deploymentTag.description: deployment tag to be updated on the device

override.description: Set this flag to override given tags over existing tags. Otherwise the tags will be merged/appended

DeviceProjectAndTargetUpdate.description: project id  will be required to move the device to a new project
DeviceProjectAndTargetUpdate.title: project id required for the devices

dhcpRange.description: Range of IP addresses to be used for DHCP

InstanceTransitionAction.description:
- INSTANCE_TA_UNSPECIFIED: Default. Invalid option
 - INSTANCE_TA_NONE: Either Edge app bundle has not changed or Edge app bundle has
changed but the changes do not impact Edge app instances
 - INSTANCE_TA_UPDATEREQUIRED: Edge app bundle has changed. Changes impact Edge app Instances
Edge App instances need to be restarted with temporary loss of access
 - INSTANCE_TA_UPDATEWITHRESTART: Transition Action: Update with Restart
 - INSTANCE_TA_UPDATEWITHPURGE: Edge app bundle has changed. Changes impact Edge app Instances
Edge App instances need to be deleted and created again with
temporary loss of access and permanent loss of data
InstanceTransitionAction.title: Instance Transition action

IoType.description:
- IO_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: No operation/ Invalid peration
 - IO_TYPE_ETH: Ethernet
 - IO_TYPE_USB: USB Type - General
 - IO_TYPE_COM: Communication Port
 - IO_TYPE_AUDIO: Audio Port
 - IO_TYPE_WLAN: wireless LAN
 - IO_TYPE_WWAN: Wireless wide area network
 - IO_TYPE_HDMI: High-Definition Multimedia Interface
 - IO_TYPE_LTE: LTE Interfaces
 - IO_TYPE_STORAGE_NVME_DEVICE: Storage NVME device
 - IO_TYPE_STORAGE_SATA_DEVICE: Storage SATA device
 - IO_TYPE_ETH_PF: Physical Interface (PF) of the Virtual Functions
 - IO_TYPE_ETH_VF: Virtual Function (VF)
 - IO_TYPE_USB_CONTROLLER: USB Type - Controller
 - IO_TYPE_USB_DEVICE: USB Type - Device
 - IO_TYPE_CAN: CAN - Device
 - IO_TYPE_VCAN: VCAN - Virtual CAN device
 - IO_TYPE_LCAN: LCAN - Logical CAN device
 - IO_TYPE_OTHER: Other Io Types
IoType.title: Input/Output Type

portTags.description: Tags are name/value pairs that enable you to categorize resources. Tag names are case insensitive with max_length 512 and min_length 3. Tag values are case sensitive with max_length 256 and min_length 3.

type.description: Type of DHCP for this Network Instance

lisp.description: Lisp Config : read only for now. Deprecated.

deviceDefault.description: flag to indicate if this is the default network instance for the device
deviceDefault.title: flag to indicate if this is default network

networkPolicyId.description: id of the network policy to be attached to this network instance

mtu.description: Maximum transmission unit (MTU) to set for the network instance and all application interfaces connected to it

NetInstConfig.description: Network instance provides Edge applications a variety of connectivity choices for all types of networks. This enables logical secure connectivity between Edge applications within a single Edge node and within a logical group of Edge nodes. This provides detailed configuration of a Network instance.
NetInstConfig.title: Network instance detailed configuration

id.description: Id of the Edge Node Cluster

designatedNodeID.description: Id of the designated Edge Node

oconfig.description: base64 encoded string of opaque config

NetInstOpaqueConfig.description: Network Instance Opaque config. This is service specific configuration.

NetworkInstanceDhcpType.title:
NetworkInstanceDhcpType: Used in the network instance provide
   dhcp server configuration

curr.description: Current Database version of the record

createdAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the record was created.

updatedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the record was last updated.

ObjectRevision.description: ObjectRevision store the user details, who has doent the necessary operation like Create Operation or update operation

TagUpdate.description: device tag will be required to auto deploy objects on the device
TagUpdate.title: tags required for the devices

severity.description: Urgency of the recommended action (ERROR - must take action immediately, WARN - must take action but not immediately, NOTICE - may take action

scope.description: Scope of the action (e.g. project, cluster, instance)

VariableFileEncoding.description:
- FILE_ENCODING_UNSPECIFIED: File content not encoded
 - FILE_ENCODING_BASE64: File content encoded in Base64
VariableFileEncoding.title: File content encoding type

maxLength.description: Max length of the value of the variable(Optional. Default: 1024)

required.description: This variable MUST be specified when creating an App Instance. (Optional. Default: False)

default.description: Default value of the variable. (Optional. Default: <Default value based on type>)

value.description: User-specified value of the variable.(Required if required is true. Optional otherwise)

encode.description: Encoding of file content. Applicable if format is VARIABLE_FORMAT_FILE

options.description: Key-Value pair of options. Applicable if format is VARIABLE_FORMAT_DROPDOWN

label.description: Display label of the key in User-Agent

value.description: Value of the key to be used

VariableVariableFormat.description:
- VARIABLE_FORMAT_UNSPECIFIED: Invalid format
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_TEXT: Value in string format
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_NUMBER: Value in integer format
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_FILE: Value to be read from a file
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_DROPDOWN: Value to be selected from dropdown of options
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_BOOLEAN: Value in boolean format
 - VARIABLE_FORMAT_PASSWORD: Value in string to be masked in User-Agent
VariableVariableFormat.title: Custom variable format

VmBootloaderMode.title:
VmBootloaderMode is used to specify the bootloader mode that will be used for the VM.
It represents the boot mechanism to be used to boot the VM

ZcOpsStatus.description:
- OPS_STATUS_PENDING: In rare cases, system may not start operation when it was requested. Client will be notified that operation is PENDING
 - OPS_STATUS_ONGOING: system will start the operation, but at the time response was generated, operation is still ONGOING.
 - OPS_STATUS_COMPLETE: Even if the result of the operations may result in failure, but the OpsStatus will marked COMPLETE for almost all cases.
ZcOpsStatus.title: ZedCloud internal operation status

ec.title:
Enumrated error code, describes more granular numerical
value than just httpStatus

details.title: Field captures string description of details

ZsrvErrorCode.description:
- zMsgErrorNone: common validation errors
 - IncompleteData: message had fields that weren't filled in
 - InvalidData: message contained the field that wasn't expected
 - FunctionUnsupported: this feature unavailable on this version of device
 - InvalidFieldFormat: message contained the field that wasn't correctly formatted
 - JsonFmtError: Marshal / Unmarshal errors
 - DataBaseConnection: generic DB error
ZsrvErrorCode.title: ZedCould internal error code

operationType.title:
Describes one of the operations type : possible values
                        Read/Delete/Create/Update/List

operationStatus.title: if this is log running job

objectKind.title: zedcloud object kind on which the operation was performed

objectId.title: Unique value identifies the object that was operated on

objectRevision.title:
object revision post the operation, note Read operation
doesn't change the revision

user.title: the operation is performed on behalf of this user

httpStatusMsg.title: summary of the error in text format

error.title:
one or more errors will be set if the operation failed
i.e. httpStatusCode != 2xx

name.description: User defined name of the app ACE, unique across the enterprise. Once object is created, name can’t be changed

netname.description: network name: will be deprecated in future, use netinstname

io.description: Physical Adapter to be matched for interface assignment. Applicable only when "direct attach" flag is true

directattach.title: comes from manifest during app create

ipaddr.title:
if netname points static DHCP then we need to take
static /32 address here

macaddr.title:
in case of p2v we might want to provide a mac-address.
applicable only in case of DHCP=passthrough

accessVlanId.description: access port VLAN ID, vlan id of zero will be treated as trunk port and vlan id 1 is implicitly used by linux bridges

eidregister.title: FIXME: Check why is this required

netinstname.description: Network Instance name to be matched for interface assignment. Applicable only when "direct attach" flag is false

netinsttag.description: Network Instance tag to be matched for interface assignment. Applicable only when "direct attach" flag is false

netinstid.description: Network Instance id to be matched for interface assignment.

allowToDiscover.description: flag tells if appInstance have permission to access the network mappings from the connected netInstance

probeMethod.description: Method to use to determine the connectivity status.

probeEndpoint.description:
Endpoint to probe using the selected probing mechanism to determine
the connectivity status.

configConnectivityProbeMethod.description:
User-defined method to use to determine the connectivity status.

 - CONNECTIVITY_PROBE_METHOD_UNSPECIFIED: Connectivity probing method is not specified and therefore will not be used.
 - CONNECTIVITY_PROBE_METHOD_ICMP: Use ICMP ping against the probed endpoint to determine the connectivity status.
 - CONNECTIVITY_PROBE_METHOD_TCP: Try to establish TCP connection with the probed endpoint to determine the connectivity
status.

port.description:
TCP port required for CONNECTIVITY_PROBE_METHOD_TCP.
Leave empty for CONNECTIVITY_PROBE_METHOD_ICMP.

configProbeEndpoint.description: Address of a remote endpoint to probe in order to determine connectivity status.

imagename.description: Name of Image Object used for the drive.

readonly.description: Read only flag. If set, drive is mounted as readonly by app instance.

preserve.description: Preserve the drive even when all app instances using it are deleted

drvtype.description: Type of Drive. Valid Values: UNSPECIFIED, CDROM, HDD, NET, HDD_EMPTY. HDD_EMPTY - is to allocate the empty disk of maxsizebytes specified

target.description: type of target. Valid values: Disk, Kernel, Initrd, RamDisk

volumelabel.description: User defined volume to use for this drive

mvolname.description: mutable Volume for this drive. Only one of imvolname and mvolname must be specified.

imvolname.description: immutable Volume for this drive. Only one of imvolname and mvolname must be specified.

ignorepurge.description: don't purge this drive as part of purge command for mutable volumes

cleartext.description: If set, don't encrypt the drive. Store in cleartext

mountpath.description: Mount Path for the drive in the App Instance

runtimeInternal.description: If set, the drive is internal to the runtime and not externally exposed with API

hvMode.description:
For now we need to tell the device which virtualization mode
to use. Later we might use a single one for all VMs (on any particular
ISA). If we end up keeping this we should make the names be less
tied to a particular hypervisor.

type.description: IoType specifies the type of the Input output of the device

tags.description: Tags are name/value pairs that enable you to categorize resources. Tag names are case insensitive with max_length 512 and min_length 3. Tag values are case sensitive with max_length 256 and min_length 3.

spType.description:
clone of types defined in API repo.

 - SPTYPE_MAPSERVER: mapping service for zededa overlay service
 - SPTYPE_SUPPORTSERVER: if device has support feature enabled, this ia cloud service
which device can be reached.

vmmMaxmem.description: Maximum amount of memory in kbytes allowed for VM monitor to occupy

bootloaderMode.description: The bootloader mode that will be used for the VM. Default is VM_BOOTLOADER_MODE_LEGACY

enableOemWinLicenseKey.description: Enable device which has VM to receive the Windows license embedded in the ACPI tables
